This serene community is home to notable sports celebrities and boasts custom single-family homes and equestrian properties ranging from 5,000 to 12,000 square feet, typically set on 1 to 5-acre lots . Discover the Unique Charm of Southwest Ranches Life in Southwest Ranches provides a peaceful, rural atmosphere where sidewalks and traffic lights are non-existent, creating a tranquil escape. Many properties feature canals or ponds, adding to the picturesque scenery and providing a natural water source for landscaping. While enjoying this quiet lifestyle, residents are still just minutes from shopping, dining, beaches, and the airport. Distinctive Features and Amenities in Southwest Ranches, FL Privacy and Space: Homes are primarily located between Sheridan Street and Griffin Road, from US 27 to Flamingo Road, offering ample privacy. Equestrian Paradise: This is a true equestrian area, perfect for horse lovers. Water Systems: Most residential homes utilize well water and salt filtration systems. Rural Roadways: Two-lane roads with side canals maintain the neighborhood's charming rural feel. Top-Rated Schools: Benefit from A-rated public schools like Hawks Elementary, Silver Trails Middle, and West Broward High, as well as excellent private school options. Expansive Parks: Enjoy numerous parks, including Rolling Oaks, Sunshine Ranches Equestrian Park, Southwest Meadows Sanctuary, Trail Side Park, Country Estates Fishing Hole Park, and Frontier Trails. Premier Neighborhoods in Southwest Ranches If you're considering making Southwest Ranches your home, here are five highly desirable neighborhoods: Rolling Oaks: Ideal for horse enthusiasts, this neighborhood offers spacious lots and a serene, private ambiance. Sunshine Ranches: Providing a rural lifestyle with excellent accessibility, this area features a mix of large estates and smaller properties amidst tree-lined streets and ample green spaces. It's also minutes from shopping centers, schools, and recreation. Country Acres: A tranquil, family-friendly community with large lots and custom-built homes, offering easy access to local parks and equestrian trails. Landmark Ranch Estates: Known for its luxury estates and expansive properties, this gated community provides an exclusive and secure living experience with convenient access to amenities. Southwest Ranches Estates: This neighborhood offers a diverse selection of estate-style and smaller homes, fostering a friendly and welcoming atmosphere and easy access to major highways, schools, and shopping. Ultimately, Southwest Ranches offers the perfect blend of privacy, peacefulness, and acreage, all while being incredibly convenient to modern conveniences. It's where you can live a quiet life with vast land, yet be just a 5 to 10-minute drive from shops and restaurants, surrounded by multiple multi-million dollar homes. Ethics Report Lobbyist Registration District Map with Council Former Town Council Members Elections Calendar Advisory Board Town Events Town Council Meetings Procurement Meeting / Agendas Frequently Asked Questions Home Departments Parks, Recreation and Open Space Frequently Asked Questions What are your days and hours of operation? The Southwest Ranches parks are open from dawn to dusk every day of the year. Park hours may vary according to the season. Contact Town Hall for more information. Is there an entrance fee? There is no charge for admission into the Southwest Ranches Parks. Entry fees may be charged for special events, if any held, in our parks. Contact Town Hall for more information. What amenities are available for children? Sunshine Ranches Equestrian Park and Country Estates Park both offer playgrounds. Stabilized grass fields are also available for miscellaneous play activities. Children must be attended at all times. Southwest Ranches Parks also offer Geocaching in various locations. Are pets allowed in the Parks? And, what are your rules and regulations? Pets are permitted in all areas subject to the following restrictions All pets must be confined, leashed, or otherwise under the physical control of a person at all times. Leashes may not exceed six feet in length Pets must be well behaved at all times. Pets may not be left unattended Pet owners shall pick up after their pets and properly dispose of all pet droppings Pets that are noisy, vicious, dangerous, disturbing or intimidating to other persons, and pets that damage park resources are considered to be nuisances and will not be permitted to remain in the park Owners of horses, dogs and other pets required by Florida Law to be vaccinated against rabies must be able to provide proof of vaccination upon demand of a Town official Domestic breeds of dogs, cats and all other pets, (except service animals) shall be excluded from playgrounds in Southwest Ranches Parks Are alcoholic beverages allowed in the parks? Alcoholic beverages are prohibited in the parks, except at the Rolling Oaks Park with an approved reservation and required insurance coverage. Where can I park my trailer? At Sunshine Ranches Equestrian Park, trailer parking is available for vehicles ranging in length from 20 to 76 feet in the center of the paved area and also in the northwest section of the stabilized grass area. At the Country Estates Park, trailer spaces are also provided. Is there fishing in the parks? Fishing is permitted in Southwest Ranches Parks in specifically designated areas. Fishing is not allowed in the Sunshine Ranches Equestrian Park. How can I become involved as a volunteer for Southwest Ranches Parks? Volunteers and community partners are encouraged to provide additional support for our parks. You, your family or service organization may volunteer to participate by donating time, money or supplies. Contact us at dlauretano@southwestranches.org to find out how you or your organization can help. Are park facilities accessible for persons using wheelchairs? Southwest Ranches Parks offer accessible facilities. If you need information about specific facilities, please call or write to us. Can I reserve the facilities for a family, business or church outing? Reservations are currently accepted for use of the shelters at Sunshine Ranches Equestrian Park and Country Estates Park. Riding rings in the Sunshine Ranches Equestrian Park may also be reserved. The Rolling Oaks Barn offers indoor meeting and event spaces available for rental. See the Policies and applications for rental facilities in Town parks. Where can I swim? There are no swimming facilities currently in Southwest Ranches Parks. Please be advised that under Florida law, e-mail addresses are public records. If you do not want your e-mail address released in response to a public records request, do not send electronic mail to this entity. Instead, contact this office by phone at (954) 434-0008 , or in writing at 13400 Griffin Road, Southwest Ranches, FL 33330.
